Savory Harissa Chicken Skewers with Grilled Vegetables

Jump to Recipe

If you're looking to elevate your grilling game this summer, these Savory Harissa Chicken Skewers with Grilled Vegetables are a must-try! Bursting with flavor and vibrant colors, this recipe combines juicy chicken breast marinated in zesty harissa paste with a medley of grilled vegetables. Not only is this dish perfect for outdoor barbecues, but it’s also a delightful option for quick weeknight dinners. Harissa, a North African chili paste, infuses the chicken with a spicy kick and a rich depth of flavor, making every bite memorable. Paired with fresh bell peppers, red onions, and zucchini, these skewers offer a perfect balance of protein, nutrients, and taste. Whether served on their own or with a side of rice or a salad, these skewers are sure to impress family and friends. Let’s dive into this easy-to-follow recipe that will bring the vibrant tastes of the Mediterranean right to your backyard!

Ingredients

chicken breast

Choose boneless, skinless chicken breasts for easier preparation. For added moisture, consider marinating the chicken for longer than 30 minutes. If you're looking for a substitute, turkey breast can work, or for a vegetarian option, use firm tofu or seitan.

harissa paste

Harissa is a North African chili paste, so if you can’t find it, you can substitute with a mix of chili powder, garlic, cumin, and a bit of olive oil. To enhance the flavor, try adding a splash of lemon juice or honey to balance the heat.

bell peppers

Use a mix of red, yellow, and green for a colorful presentation. For an alternative, feel free to substitute with other vegetables like cherry tomatoes or mushrooms. To enhance sweetness, you can grill the peppers for a short time before adding them to the skewers.

red onion

Red onions add a sweet flavor when grilled, but for a milder taste, consider soaking them in cold water for 10 minutes before using. If you need a substitute, yellow onions or shallots can also work.

zucchini

Choose firm zucchini without blemishes for the best flavor. You can substitute with yellow squash or eggplant. To prevent sogginess, salt the zucchini slices and let them sit for 10 minutes to draw out moisture before skewering.

olive oil

Extra virgin olive oil has a great flavor and is ideal for grilling. If you need a substitute, avocado oil is a good option due to its high smoke point. For flavor enhancement, you could mix in some minced garlic or fresh herbs.

salt

Use kosher salt for seasoning as it dissolves easily and enhances flavor without overpowering. For a substitute, sea salt works well, but be cautious with table salt as it is more concentrated.

pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper provides the best flavor. For a twist, consider using white pepper for a different taste or adding crushed red pepper flakes for extra heat.

wooden skewers

Soaking the skewers in water prevents them from burning on the grill. If you’re grilling frequently, consider investing in metal skewers, which are reusable and provide even heat distribution.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Soak the Skewers

    Start by soaking the wooden skewers in water for 10-15 minutes. This step is crucial as it prevents the skewers from burning on the grill, allowing you to enjoy your skewers without any charred bits.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Chicken

    Cut the chicken breast into bite-sized cubes, roughly 1-2 inches each. Place them in a bowl. This size ensures even cooking and makes them easy to eat once grilled.

  • Step 3: Marinate the Chicken

    Add 2 tablespoons of harissa paste, 2 tablespoons of olive oil, and season with salt and pepper to the chicken. Mix well until all pieces are evenly coated. For optimal flavor, let the chicken marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator. This allows the spices to penetrate the meat.

  • Step 4: Chop the Vegetables

    While the chicken is marinating, chop the bell peppers (1 each of red, yellow, and green) and the medium red onion and zucchini into roughly equal-sized chunks. This ensures that everything cooks uniformly and looks visually appealing on the skewers.

  • Step 5: Assemble the Skewers

    Once marinated, thread the chicken and chopped vegetables onto the soaked skewers, alternating between chicken and veggies. Aim for a colorful arrangement to make your dish visually appealing.

  • Step 6: Preheat the Grill

    Preheat your grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. This step is important as it ensures you get a nice sear on the chicken and vegetables, locking in the flavors.

  • Step 7: Grill the Skewers

    Place the assembled skewers on the grill and cook for about 10-15 minutes. Turn them occasionally to ensure even cooking. The chicken should reach an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C) and have nice grill marks.

  • Step 8: Rest and Serve

    Remove the skewers from the grill and let them rest for a few minutes. This helps the juices redistribute throughout the chicken, making it more tender. Serve hot with your choice of sides or a refreshing salad.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare chicken breast for skewers?

Start by cutting the chicken breast into bite-sized cubes, around 1 to 1.5 inches. This size helps them cook evenly and stay juicy.

What is harissa paste and where can I find it?

Harissa paste is a North African chili paste made from hot peppers, spices, and herbs. You can find it in the international aisle of grocery stores or at specialty markets.

How do I ensure the skewers don't burn on the grill?

Soak wooden skewers in water for 10-15 minutes before using them. This prevents them from catching fire and helps them withstand the heat.

What vegetables can I use for skewers?

You can use a variety of vegetables! Bell peppers, red onions, zucchini, cherry tomatoes, mushrooms, and even eggplant work well. Just make sure to cut them into similar sizes for even cooking.

How do I know when the chicken is fully cooked?

Chicken is safe to eat when it reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (75°C). You can use a meat thermometer to check. Additionally, the chicken should no longer be pink in the center.

What are some tips for grilling the skewers?

Preheat your grill to medium-high heat for about 10 minutes. Place the skewers on the grill and turn them occasionally to ensure even cooking and nice grill marks. Aim for about 10-15 minutes total cooking time.

Can I marinate the chicken in advance?

Yes! Marinating the chicken for at least 30 minutes (or up to overnight in the fridge) will enhance its flavor. Just remember to store it in an airtight container.

What should I do if I don’t have a grill?

You can use a grill pan on the stovetop or even bake the skewers in the oven at 400°F (200°C) for about 20-25 minutes, turning halfway through.

How should I serve the skewers?

Allow the skewers to rest for a few minutes after grilling. You can serve them on a platter with a side of rice, couscous, or a fresh salad for a complete meal.

What should I do with leftover skewers?

Store leftover skewers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days. You can reheat them in the oven or microwave, but be careful not to overcook the chicken.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish can easily be made gluten-free by ensuring that the harissa paste is gluten-free. For a vegetarian option, substitute chicken with firm tofu or marinated portobello mushrooms and keep the same marinating process. For a lower-carb option, serve with a side of grilled vegetables only, avoiding the pita.

Pairings

Serve the Savory Harissa Chicken Skewers with a side of tzatziki sauce or garlic yogurt dip to complement the spicy flavors. Pair with a refreshing cucumber and tomato salad for a cool contrast. For beverages, opt for a chilled Sauvignon Blanc or a light craft beer, which can complement the spices beautifully.

Serving Suggestions

Arrange the skewers on a large platter and garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley for a pop of color. Serve with lemon wedges on the side for a zesty finish. Consider offering warm pita bread or flatbreads to soak up the juices, making it a more filling meal. For a more casual setting, serve the skewers as part of a barbecue buffet with various dipping sauces and side salads.

Savory Harissa Chicken Skewers with Grilled Vegetables

30 min
$10
320 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 4

Dietary Tags:

High ProteinLow Carb

Cuisine:

Description

Juicy chicken marinated in spicy harissa, grilled to perfection with colorful vegetables for a delicious meal.

Ingredients

  • chicken breast: 1 lb
  • harissa paste: 2 tbsp
  • bell peppers: 1 each (red, yellow, green)
  • red onion: 1 medium
  • zucchini: 1 medium
  • olive oil: 2 tbsp
  • salt: to taste
  • pepper: to taste
  • wooden skewers: 5-6
